data: {"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3492077,"name":"5089 Robonerds","username":"RoboNerds5089","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/r/a183cd/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-01-25T00:11:30.550Z","cooked":"\u003cp\u003eWe’re in the process of getting our swerve drive running and were encountering an issue with our angle motors. They are all going to the wrong positions and before they stop they seem to turn the motor too far and then jiggle back to a stop. We tried tuning the \u003cspan class=\"abbreviation\"\u003ePID\u003ctemplate class=\"tooltiptext\" data-text=\"Proportional Integral Derivative\"\u003e\u003c/template\u003e\u003c/span\u003e values but they are all turning out of sync and are inconsistently showing the correct movement for all modules. We’re using \u003cspan class=\"abbreviation\"\u003eSDS\u003ctemplate class=\"tooltiptext\" data-text=\"Swerve Drive Specialties\"\u003e\u003c/template\u003e\u003c/span\u003e MK4N modules with Krakens and CANCoders with a pigeon 2 gyro. One thing we’ve also noticed is our absolute encoder values that we input are changing from around 0.09 - 0.04 when we check in the Phoenix Pro
